reviewText: I had ordered this for my sister's birthday and became a huge fan of the show too!  This was a great deal for the first four seasons..(the best seasons I think)...and we watched them a lot.  My only problem with them was that the second disc of the first season would not play at all.  It would have gotten 5 stars but for that.  Great show!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Forget Calling Ghost Busters, if you have troubles with Ghosts, Demons, Vampires, Ghouls or any other supernatural creature, you want to call Sam and Dean; these guys know how to kick monster butt and they are HOT HOT HOT! Hot Guys with a Rad Car, Classic Rock and cool monster effects will have you begging for more. Some of the guys involved with the production of Supernatural were also key figures in the production of the X-Files and you may see some similarities, however these story have a new dynamic edge to them, with Great Writing and State of Art Special Effects. Supernatural will have you checking under the bed for monsters and maybe even under the sheets for Sam or Dean (if only...).GREAT SHOW!
summary: Who ya gonna call? I'm putting Sam and Dean on Speed Dial
Title: N/A

reviewText: P.S. bought my set new from one of the recommended sites given by amazon, so got it cheaper, than what Amazon is selling for, so feel free to save and use a site they thoughtfully recommend.Supernatural Season 1-4First let me preface this by saying, If you are Wiccan, Pagan, Witch, or Christian, don't get your knickers in a knot.  They used definitions of witches taken from tortured sources during the inquisitions, as well as b/s uses of certain herbs, and plants. It's only a movie, a Thriller series, and they take a lot of liberties for their storylines, and they trash Mythos across the board.  But it makes the Spookies part work.No frontal nudity, light on T & A, but done in a tasteful way, by way of the Plot progression.  Most use T&A; in absentia of actual an actual script or plot, and need it to keep fan attention.  Not here, they have actual talent on hand.I'll be honest, not all the stories are great, but hey, no series ever hits 100%.  Some are quirky, there's a lot of humor, references to old movie one liners.  This series is a treat.It has gore, violence, creepyness, everything a good vs. evil story should have.  And the blur between the two, is definitely highlighted in this series.I bought this as a gift for a family member.  I didn't think I'd like it, as I was somewhat obligated to watch, as a family share event (san's children) of course.  I actually enjoyed this series.  Two brothers with a mysterious past, fighting demons, witches, and all sorts of scary badies.  Creepy possessed children. And of course Angels, with suspicious intents.  I can't wait for season five to come out.  It will be Kripkes final work.  Season six someone new takes over.The Brothers are fighting together to try and stop the apocalypse.  The acting talent that comes forth is pretty awesome as well (some not so well but good out weighs bad).  Plenty of hot babes for guys, and of course hunky stud muffins for the women.  Truly creepy bad guys, and scary themes that make you go What the ****.  Complete with the appropriate amount of gore, they even get some of the sigils correct.  Alister  the Demon is particularly well done.  If your prone to nightmares don't watch.  Always try before you buy.  But this is definitely worth the price for the viewing pleasures, the laughter, the tragedy, the scare.  It's fantastic.  For this day and age anyway.  If you enjoyed the Angel series, the Charmed series, The Merlin series you will love to watch this entertaining scare fest.  The Demon killing Colt 45 is way, way out there, but still an inventive use of legend.  Oh, some parts are really gross, so wait to eat till afterward.  Padalecki and Ackles definitely make the Brothers interactions work in intense effect. As well as make the roles believable. Of course other actors in this series add to the Plot with their incredible skills as well.  (Watch, you'll know the ones I mean,  a few, very few of the actors suck in their roles, but as I stated, more good than bad, so all's right with the world.) hahahahaha  Take Care.

reviewText: Debuting in September 2005 Supernatural follows the lives of two brothers (Dean and Jensen Winchester) who hunt demons and other supernatural figures, such as werewolves, and vampires. What begins in season one as mostly one shot episodes gradually develops into a wider, all encompassing story arc that sets the two brothers up in season five as pivotal figures in an approaching apocalypse that pits heaven against hell with humans in the middle.This series features a wonderfully creative team of writers who obviously enjoy experimenting with various themes and realities. One never knows from episode to episode what mischief the brothers will find themselves in. There is definitely a playful approach to subject matter which still manages to be scary and hip at the same time. Take for instance the references to the X-Files themes of aliens, which for the Winchesters are pure fiction, even though they are immersed in an equally strange world of demons and other supernatural wonders. What drives this series though is the comradeship and bond between the two brothers as they take to the roads across America in search of demons and adventure. "Supernatural" is pure scary fun with great special effects and a rich ensemble of interesting characters.On April 26th 2011 a seventh season was renewed for the 2011-2012 season.
summary: A road trip through America's dark side...

reviewText: If you are a fan of this show this is a must have.  This show is fantastic & the characters of Dean & Sam are awesome.  It has a bit of everything in the show.  Have to say Dean is my favorite character & just cracks me up with his witty comments.  Not only do I have all the seasons but am also reading the books & love them to.  BUY IT - you won't be sorry

reviewText: I had heard of this series from many friends, but had never seen it myself.  When it came up on the "deal of the day" at such a great price, I couldn't resist.  I thought 'if I don't like it I can give it to one of my buddies who does.'  Well it is staying with us!  Both my husband and I really have enjoyed it so far.  We only watch it after the kids go to bed, or are at their grandparent's house, but that means we get to savor it for a while longer.  It is very fun, and just the right amount of scary.  Will definitely be picking-up the next seasons when we finish these.

reviewText: Got into watching this series but I missed a lot of the previous seasons so I broke down and bought the set.  I love it, catching up is got great.  Sam and Dean are great characters and my daughter loves Misha Collins as Castiel.  This is what all TV should be (I'm a LOST deserter cause they couldn't keep up the quality like Supernatural has).  Though I really like the series up to now, I'm really concerned about how their going to keep up the quality of the writing.  All in all I think everyone should get into this series it about more that monsters.

reviewText: Having experienced the supernatual first hand and having lived in haunted houses, I'd say that the writers of this series have a few shades of truth behind the story line and running through the embellishments of the character casts. Of course we all know that supernatural entities can't be wiped out with modern weapons, that's understandable TV entertainment. That aside, real supernatural reality is often a shock to the average human who has to deal with it. It'll take you more than an hour per episode to solve.This series is by far one of the most entertaining, if not the most entertaining, TV series with a supernatural theme! Not even "Buffy the Vampire Slayer", "Blade", "Ghost Whisperer" come close. The series presents the Winchester family's journey (the 2 brothers in particular) in their constant brushes with the supernatural and how they come to terms with the reality that most common folks doubt exist. (Do the 2 brothers have to work for a living? We know that Buffy the Vampire Slayer had school to contend with, but what about these 2 siblings here?) Entity species presented in the series are commonly evoked ones in their related human circles and are dramatically presented with color and style in this series. The script writers have done their homework.This DVD set is pricey though! (1 star rating for the selling price!)If you've missed watching this series on TV, this DVD set is here to stay.Watch this entire series before the Anti-Christ comes! LOL!Recommended watching:A Haunting - Seasons 1-4
